newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico same-day peso ends weaker, Cetes forecast.
newsitem.headline: Mexico same-day peso ends weaker, Cetes forecast.

text.p: Mexico's same-day peso closed 2.6 centavos weaker at 7.7460/7.7510 per dollar on Tuesday due to mixed forecasts about the results of the primary Cetes auction failing to buttress the peso, traders said.

"The peso is still under pressure after fluctuating during the session...the outcome for primary Cetes rates will continue to determine how difficult the foreign exchange market will be," said a trader.
The benchmark 48-hour and 24-hour peso contracts were meanwhile 3.2 and 2.8 centavos weaker, respectively, at 7.7730/7.7780 and 7.7630/7.7680 per dollar.
Traders said they expected hikes of about 100 basis points on bellwether 28-day Cetes rates at Tuesday evening's primary auction, and longer term rates to be unchanged.
"I don't feel there's much interest in peso-denominated returns at these levels, so we have seen demand (for dollars) prevailing in a somewhat erratic (foreign exchange) market," a trader said.
Traders located a strong support for the 48-hour peso at 7.80 per dollar which, if broken, could take the peso to its weakest level of the year at 7.8450 per dollar, they said.
